meanings.definition: The arrangement or proportioning of columns in a building.
meanings.sent1: The columniation of the ancient temple was truly impressive.
meanings.sent2: The architect carefully planned the columniation of the new courthouse.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to mimic the columniation of the trees by stacking acorns.
meanings.sent4: The columniation of support from the community held up the charity event.
meanings.sent5: The columniation of the skyscrapers against the city skyline was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The act of forming into columns.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers' columniation during the parade was flawless.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers demonstrated efficient columniation of the steel beams.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully engaged in columniation by stacking building blocks.
meanings.sent4: The columniation of ants marching in a straight line fascinated the young biologist.
meanings.sent5: The columniation of books on the shelf made it easy to find the desired title.

meanings.definition: The system of columns in a building.
meanings.sent1: The grand hall's columniation added elegance to the architecture.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins revealed the intricate columniation of the temple.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon attempted to climb the columniation of the house's pillars.
meanings.sent4: The columniation of support beams in the bridge provided stability during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The columniation of marble pillars in the palace symbolized strength and power.
